gw.plugin.document

Interface IDocumentTemplateDescriptor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XMLDocumentTemplateDescriptor

    public interface IDocumentTemplateDescriptor
    The IDocumentTemplateDescriptor interface defines the API which must be implemented by an object which represents a document template descriptor. A document template descriptor, in turn, corresponds to an actual document template (Word MailMerge template, PDF form, etc) and contains five different kinds of information:

    1. Metadata about the template itself (id, name, effective dates, etc)
    2. Metadata defaults which should be applied to documents created from the template (status, etc)
    3. The set of values which are referenced by the values to be inserted into the document template, known as "Context Objects". This includes both default values and a set of legal alternative values for use in the document creation UI.
    4. The set of field names and values to be inserted into the document template, including some formatting information.
    5. The locale in which the document will be generated in

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  IDocumentTemplateDescriptor.Scope

      Returns the string which will actually be filled into the completed document, given the field name and the value (which is probably a result of evaluating the expression returned from getFormFieldValueExpression()).

        Constant Field Values

      • TEMPLATEID

        static final java.lang.String TEMPLATEID
        REQUIRED. The unique ID of the template
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NAME

        static final java.lang.String NAME
        REQUIRED. A human-readable name for the template
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IDENTIFIER

        static final java.lang.String IDENTIFIER
        OPTIONAL. An additional human-readable identifier for the template. This often corresponds to a well-known domain-specific document code. For example, to indicate a state-mandated form for this template.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCOPE

        static final java.lang.String SCOPE
        REQUIRED. The contexts that this template supports. Possible values are • ui – the document template must only be used from the document creation user interface • gosu – the document template must only be used from rules or other Gosu and must not appear in a list the user interface template. • all – the document template may be used from any context
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PASSWORD

        static final java.lang.String PASSWORD
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DESCRIPTION

        static final java.lang.String DESCRIPTION
        REQUIRED. A human-readable description of the template and/or the document it creates.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SECTION

        static final java.lang.String SECTION
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE

        static final java.lang.String TYPE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIMETYPE

        static final java.lang.String MIMETYPE
        REQUIRED. The type of document to create from this document template. In the built-in implementation of document source, this determines which IDocumentProduction implementation to use to create documents from this template. Also see documentProductionType. In the IDocumentTemplateDescriptor interface, this is the mimeType property.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DOCUMENTPRODUCTIONTYPE

        static final java.lang.String DOCUMENTPRODUCTIONTYPE
        OPTIONAL. If present, a specified document production type indirectly specifies which implementation of IDocumentProduction to use to create a new document from the template. This is not the only way to select a document production plugin implementation. You can also use a MIME type, see the row for mime-type.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATEMODIFIED

        static final java.lang.String DATEMODIFIED
        OPTIONAL. The date the template was last modified. In the default implementation, this is set from the information on the XML file itself. Both getter and setter methods exist for this property so that the date can be set by the IDocumentTemplateSource implementation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATEEFFECTIVE

        static final java.lang.String DATEEFFECTIVE
        REQUIRED. The effective and expiration dates for the template.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATEEXPIRES

        static final java.lang.String DATEEXPIRES
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_SECURITY_TYPE

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_SECURITY_TYPE
        OPTIONAL. Security type in the DocumentSecurityType typelist. This is the security type that becomes the default value for the corresponding document metadata fields for documents created using this template.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEYWORDS

        static final java.lang.String KEYWORDS
        REQUIRED. A set of keywords to search for within the template.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REQUIREDPERMISSION

        static final java.lang.String REQUIREDPERMISSION
        OPTIONAL. The code of the SystemPermissionType value required for the user to see and use this template. Templates for which the user does not have the appropriate permission do not appear in the user interface
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAILMERGETYPE_PROP

        static final java.lang.String MAILMERGETYPE_PROP
        OPTIONAL: Optional configuration of pagination of Microsoft Word production.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REQUIREDSYMBOLS

        static final java.lang.String REQUIREDSYMBOLS
        REQUIRED. A list of programmatic symbols that are required in this context for this template to work correctly at run time. For the user interface, this is a filtering mechanism.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STANDARD_METADATA_NAMES

        static final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> STANDARD_METADATA_NAMES

    • Method Detail

      • getTemplateId

        java.lang.String getTemplateId()
        Returns the unique ID of the template which this descriptor describes.
        Returns:
        The ID of the document template which this descriptor describes.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the human-readable name of the template in the current locale
        Returns:
        the name of the template in the current locale

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName(ILocale locale)
        Returns the human-readable localized name of the template.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale of the name. Null means the default name.
        Returns:
        The human-readable localized name of the template. Return null if no name match to the given locale

      • getIdentifier

        java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns an (optional) human-readable identifier string. Often used in Workers' Comp documents, sometimes corresponds to the ID of the Form on which the template is based.
        Returns:
        An (optional) human-readable identifier string.

      • getScope

        java.lang.String getScope()
        Returns the contexts in which this document should be used. Possible values are: gosu - denotes documents which should only be created from gosu, and which should not show up in the UI ui - denotes documents which should only be created through the UI, and which cannot be created from rules all - denotes documents which may be created through either mechanism (and will show up in the UI)
        Returns:
        The contexts in which this document should be used.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns human-readable description of the template and/or the document it will create.
        Returns:
        Human-readable description of the template and/or the document it will create.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription(ILocale locale)
        Returns the human-readable localized description of the template.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale of the description. Null means the default description.
        Returns:
        The human-readable localized description of the template. Return null if no description match to the given locale

      • getPassword

        java.lang.String getPassword()
        Returns the password which is required for the user to create a document from the template. This is optional; if no password is required, it should return null. May not be supported by all document formats (for example, not supported for Gosu templates).
        Returns:
        The password which is required for the user to create a document from the template, or null if none is required.

      • getDocumentProductionType

        java.lang.String getDocumentProductionType()
        Returns a code which will be used by the document production system to determine how to generate the document from the template. In the default implementation, recognized codes are "word", "excel", "acrobat", and "gosu". May return null, which (in the default IDocumentProduction implementation) will result in generation based on the mime type.
        Returns:
        a code indicating how to generate documents from the template, or null.

      • getTemplateType

        java.lang.String getTemplateType()
        Returns a value which should correspond to a code in the DocumentType typelist. May return null. If the returned value is not null, documents created from this template will have their "type" fields set to this value.
        Returns:
        A value which should correspond to a code in the DocumentType typelist, or null.

      • getMimeType

        java.lang.String getMimeType()
        Returns the type of document which will be created from this document template. Note that if this is inaccurate, it will be overridden when the created document gets uploaded to the system.
        Returns:
        The mime type of documents created from this template.

      • getDateModified

        java.util.Date getDateModified()
        Returns the date this template was last modified.
        Returns:
        The date this template was last modified.

      • setDateModified

        void setDateModified(java.util.Date dateModified)
        Updates the modification date for this template. This change will not be persisted, but instead is only used for the in-memory representation of the template descriptor.
        Parameters:
        dateModified - The new value for the last-modified date.

      • getDateEffective

        java.util.Date getDateEffective()
        Returns the effective date of the template. When the user searches for a template, this value represents the lower bound on the date values for which this template will appear.
        Returns:
        The effective date of the template.

      • getDateExpiration

        java.util.Date getDateExpiration()
        Returns the expiration date of the template. When the user searches for a template, this value represents the upper bound on the date values for which this template will appear.
        Returns:
        The expiration date of the template.

      • getKeywords

        java.lang.String[] getKeywords()
        Returns an array of keywords which can be used to search for this template.
        Returns:
        An array of keywords which can be used to search for this template.

      • getRequiredPermission

        java.lang.String getRequiredPermission()
        Returns the code of the SystemPermissionType value, if any, required for the user to use this template. Templates for which the user does not have the appropriate permission will not appear in the UI. May return null.
        Returns:
        The code of the SystemPermissionType value required for the user to use this template, or null if none.

      • getDefaultSecurityType

        java.lang.String getDefaultSecurityType()
        Returns the code of the DocumentSecurityType value to be used as the default value for the SecurityType field on Documents created from this template. May return null if no default value is desired.
        Returns:
        The code of the DocumentSecurityType value to be used as the default value for the SecurityType field on Documents created from this template.

      • getMetadataPropertyNames

        java.lang.String[] getMetadataPropertyNames()
        Returns the set of extra metadata properties which exist in the document template definition. This is used in conjunction with getMetadataPropertyValue() as a flexible extension mechanism. Customers can add arbitrary new fields to document template descriptors, and these will be passed on to the internal entities used to display document templates in the UI.

        Also note that, where the extra property names correspond to properties on the Document entity, the values will be passed along to documents created from the template.

        Returns:
        The complete set of metadata properties specified in this template descriptor.

      • getMetadataPropertyValue

        java.lang.Object getMetadataPropertyValue(java.lang.String propName)
        Returns the value specified for the given metadata property in this template descriptor.
        Parameters:
        propName - The name of the metadata property whose value is desired.
        Returns:
        The value specified for the given metadata property in this template descriptor.

      • getContextObjectNames

        java.lang.String[] getContextObjectNames()
        Returns the names of the context objects defined in this template descriptor. Context objects are values which can be selected by the user (in the case of interactive document generation) or through Gosu, and which can then be referenced in the form field value expressions.
        Returns:
        The names of the context objects defined in this template descriptor.

      • getContextObjectType

        java.lang.String getContextObjectType(java.lang.String objName)
        Returns the type of the specified context object.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        The type of the specified context object. Possible values include "string", "text", "Bean", or the name of any system entity or typelist("Claim", etc).

      • getContextObjectIType

        IType getContextObjectIType(java.lang.String objName)
        Returns the IType of the specified context object.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        The IType of the specified context object.

      • getContextObjectAllowsNull

        boolean getContextObjectAllowsNull(java.lang.String objName)
        Indicates whether null is a legal value for the given context object.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        True if null is a legal value for this context object, false otherwise.

      • getContextObjectDisplayName

        java.lang.String getContextObjectDisplayName(java.lang.String objName)
        Returns a human-readable display name for the given context object.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        The display name which should be used to represent the ContextObject in the UI.

      • getContextObjectDefaultValueExpression

        java.lang.String getContextObjectDefaultValueExpression(java.lang.String objName)
        Returns a Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired default value for the context object. This will be used to set the default for the document creation UI, or as the value if a document is created automatically and no other value is specified.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired default value for the context object.

      • getCompiledContextObjectDefaultValueExpression

        IGosuProgram getCompiledContextObjectDefaultValueExpression(ISymbolTable symTable,
                                                            java.lang.String objName)
        Returns a compiled Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired default value for the context object. This will be used to set the default for the document creation UI, or as the value if a document is created automatically and no other value is specified.
        Parameters:
        symTable - The symbol table containing necessary symbols for compilation.
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired default value for the context object.

      • getContextObjectPossibleValuesExpression

        java.lang.String getContextObjectPossibleValuesExpression(java.lang.String objName)
        Returns a Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired set of legal values for the given context object. Used to display a list of options for the user in the document creation UI.
        Parameters:
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired set of legal values for the given Context Object.

      • getCompiledContextObjectPossibleValuesExpression

        IGosuProgram getCompiledContextObjectPossibleValuesExpression(ISymbolTable symTable,
                                                              java.lang.String objName)
        Returns a compiled Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired set of legal values for the given context object. Used to display a list of options for the user in the document creation UI.
        Parameters:
        symTable - The symbol table containing necessary symbols for compilation.
        objName - The name of a context object. Must be a valid context object name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired possible values for the context object.

      • getFormFieldNames

        java.lang.String[] getFormFieldNames()
        Returns the set of names of the form fields defined in the document template.
        Returns:
        The names of the form fields defined in this template descriptor

      • getFormFieldValueExpression

        java.lang.String getFormFieldValueExpression(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Returns a Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired value for the form field. The Gosu expression is usually written in terms of one or more context objects, but any legal Gosu expression is allowed.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of a form field. Must be a valid form field name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu expression which will evaluate to the desired value for the form field.

      • getFormFieldCompiledExpression

        IGosuProgram getFormFieldCompiledExpression(ISymbolTable symTable,
                                            java.lang.String fieldName)
        Returns a Gosu compiled expression which will evaluate to the desired value for the form field. The Gosu expression is usually written in terms of one or more context objects, but any legal Gosu expression is allowed.
        Parameters:
        symTable - The symbol table containing necessary symbols for compilation
        fieldName - The name of a form field. Must be a valid form field name.
        Returns:
        A Gosu compiled expression which will evaluate to the desired value for the form field.

      • getFormFieldDisplayValue

        java.lang.String getFormFieldDisplayValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                          java.lang.Object value)
        Returns the string which will actually be filled into the completed document, given the field name and the value (which is probably a result of evaluating the expression returned from getFormFieldValueExpression()).

        This allows the implementation to do some value rewriting, such as substituting "n/a" for null, formatting dates nicely, etc.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of a form field. Must be a valid form field name.
        value - The current value for the form field.
        Returns:
        The value which should be filled in to the template for the indicated form field. May be the same as the passed-in value, may be a reformatting of same, or may be completely different.

      • getLocale

        ILocale getLocale()
        Deprecated. Should use getLanguage instead, documents are stored by language not locale/regional formatting
        Returns the locale in which the document will be generated from this template descriptor. Null value means unknown locale. Most of the time, it should be the default language of the application.
        Returns:
        the locale in which the document will be generated.

      • getLanguage

        ILocale getLanguage()
        Returns the language in which the document will be generated from this template descriptor. Null value means unknown locale. Most of the time, it should be the default language of the application.
        Returns:
        the language in which the document will be generated.
